head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Bronx: Voter Registration Urged

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Bronx: Voter Registration Urged

block.p: State Senator Jeffrey D. Klein said yesterday that New York should expand its efforts to encourage young people to register to vote. Senator Klein, a Democrat who represents parts of the Bronx and Westchester County, said a survey of 60 colleges and universities in the state conducted by his staff found that none of the private institutions mailed voter forms to students and only 10 percent of the public ones did so. Only half of the private universities surveyed provided registration information on campus, he said. Senator Klein has proposed requiring the state to mail voter registration forms to all residents when they turn 18.
